DataElement.preferredName: Near Breast Surgical Margin Extensive In Situ Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to presence of close breast resection margin and extensive in-situ component.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Near Breast Surgical Margin Extensive In Situ Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to presence of close breast resection margin and extensive in-situ component.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.:in the natural or normal place, confined to the site of origin without invasion of neighboring tissues. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.
In the natural or normal place, confined to the site of origin without invasion of neighboring tissues.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
